item.title: 7 best space photos captured by NASA Hubble Telescope - India.com
item.description:
7 Best Space Photos Captured by NASA Hubble Telescope

Publication Date: 2024-01
Source: India.com

Discover the magnificent images captured by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope in 2024, showcasing some of the most stunning celestial phenomena.

  • This article explores seven remarkable images taken by the Hubble Space Telescope.
  • Highlights include the Crab Nebula and the densely packed globular cluster NGC 1841.
  • Features images depicting galaxies and nebulae located millions of light-years away.
  • Images reveal scientific phenomena, including supernova remnants and galaxy collisions.
“This composite image of the Crab Nebula, a supernova remnant in the Milky Way galaxy, was captured by the Herschel Space Observatory and Hubble Space Telescope.”

This collection illustrates the beauty and complexity of our universe as seen through the Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting its invaluable contributions to astronomy.

item.title: Samsung Brings ‘Vision AI’ Features For Smart TVs At CES 2025: All Details - News18
item.description:
Samsung Unveils ‘Vision AI’ Features for Smart TVs at CES 2025

Date: January 07, 2025
Source: News18

Samsung is revolutionizing their premium TV lineup by introducing a range of AI features dubbed ‘Vision AI’ at CES 2025.

  • Samsung is launching AI features for Smart TVs, termed ‘Vision AI’.
  • Notable features include Click to Search, Live Translate, and Generative Wallpaper.
  • New collaborations with Microsoft and Google enhance the capabilities of Samsung’s AI features.
  • The flagship models include advanced AI processing capabilities with enhancements like 8K AI Upscaling Pro.
  • Samsung’s Vision AI provides real-time subtitle translations for live content.
“Samsung claimed that they would work with Google to expand what Vision AI can do.”

In conclusion, Samsung’s focus on AI at CES 2025 marks a significant step forward in enhancing user experience through innovative applications.

item.title: 7.1 magnitude earthquake in Nepal, tremors felt in Delhi-NCR - Hindustan Times
item.description:
7.1 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Nepal, Tremors Felt in Delhi-NCR

Date: Jan 07, 2025 Source: HT News

A 7.1 magnitude earthquake struck Nepal on Tuesday morning, with tremors felt across Delhi-NCR and parts of North India including Bihar. Fortunately, no property damage has been reported.

  • The earthquake occurred at 6:35 AM IST, 93 km northeast of Lobuche.
  • People in Bihar were seen evacuating their homes during the tremors.
  • The earthquake's epicenter was near the Nepal-Tibet border, a seismically active area.
  • Two aftershocks of magnitudes 4.7 and 4.9 were recorded shortly after the main quake.
“EQ of M: 7.1, On: 07/01/2025 06:35:18 IST.” - National Centre for Seismology

The occurrence of this earthquake highlights the ongoing seismic activity in the region, prompting monitoring from geological authorities.

item.title: First Time In 136 Years: Shan Masood Ton Helps Pakistan Set Massive Follow-On Record vs South Africa.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
First Time In 136 Years: Shan Masood Ton Helps Pakistan Set Massive Follow-On Record vs South Africa

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

Pakistan fought valiantly but ultimately lost to South Africa in the second Test at Cape Town, despite a remarkable 478 runs in the second innings while following on, led by captain Shan Masood's 145.

  • Pakistan set a record total of 478 while following on, the highest by a visiting team in South Africa in 136 years.
  • The previous record for the highest follow-on total was 372/7 by Australia in 1902.
  • Shan Masood's innings of 145 was pivotal along with significant contributions from Babar Azam (81) and other batsmen.
  • Despite the impressive total, South Africa chased down a target of 58 runs comfortably.
  • The win secured South Africa's top position in the World Test Championship table.
“It surpasses the previous best follow-on total of 372/7 set by Australia in Johannesburg in 1902.”

In conclusion, while Pakistan put up a historic performance, South Africa confirmed their dominance by clinching the series 2-0 and setting their sights on the upcoming World Test Championship final.

item.title: Realme 14 Pro Series to launch on January 16 with colour-changing tech, advanced cameras and more - India TV News
item.description:
Realme 14 Pro Series to launch on January 16 with colour-changing tech, advanced cameras and more

Publication Date: January 7, 2025
Source: India TV News

Realme has officially announced the launch of the highly anticipated Realme 14 Pro series. The lineup, which includes the Realme 14 Pro and Realme 14 Pro+, is set to debut on January 16 at noon IST.

  • The devices will be available on Flipkart and the official Realme website.
  • Colour-changing technology allows the Pearl White variant to change color in response to water exposure.
  • Powerful processors: Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 for Pro+ and MediaTek Dimensity 7300 for Pro.
  • Quad-curved display with IP68 water and dust resistance.
  • Camera innovations include a 50MP periscope lens, multiple zoom capabilities, and advanced AI photography features.
  • Expected battery capacity of 6,000mAh with durability ratings IP66, IP68, and IP69.
  • Price increase expected over predecessors, with Pro+ starting around Rs 32,999 and Pro over Rs 26,999.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 series launch date revealed: what to expect from Galaxy Unpacked 2025 | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 series launch date revealed: what to expect from Galaxy Unpacked 2025

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: LiveMint

Samsung has officially confirmed that its next Galaxy Unpacked event will be held on January 22, where new Galaxy AI features and the Galaxy S25 series will be launched.

Key Points:

  • The Galaxy Unpacked event is scheduled for January 22, 2025, at 10 am PT in San Jose.
  • Pre-reservations for the Galaxy S25 series in India are available, offering benefits up to ₹5,000 for a fee of ₹1,999.
  • Pre-orders for the Galaxy S25 series are expected to open on January 24, with sales starting on February 4.
  • Features of the Galaxy S25 series include Snapdragon 8 Elite processors, upgraded camera setups, improved charging speeds, and possibly MagSafe-like charging.
“This event will change the way you interact with the world every day.”

In conclusion, the upcoming Galaxy Unpacked event promises significant updates and new releases that could reshape user experience in smartphones.

item.title: Pushpa 2 box office collection Day 33: Allu Arjun starrer enters sees 65% drop on 5th Monday; film become - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Achieves Over Rs 800 Crore at Box Office Despite 65% Drop on 5th Monday

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Pushpa 2: The Rule, featuring Allu Arjun, has been achieving remarkable box office success but faced a notable 65% drop in earnings on its fifth Monday.

  • The film earned an estimated Rs 2.5 crore on its fifth Monday.
  • It grossed Rs 725.8 crore in its opening week.
  • The second week saw an additional Rs 264.8 crore.
  • In the third and fourth weeks, it earned Rs 129.5 crore and Rs 69.65 crore, respectively.
  • The cumulative net collection in India stands at approximately Rs 1208.7 crore.
  • The Hindi-dubbed version has surpassed Rs 800 crore, a first for Hindi releases.
  • Globally, the film has grossed around Rs 1800 crore in just four weeks.
“Pushpa 2 has solidified its status as a blockbuster.”

This achievement underscores the film’s significant popularity and Allu Arjun's strong performance, making it a standout in the Indian cinema landscape.

item.title: Brazil announces Indonesia's full membership in BRICS - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Brazil Welcomes Indonesia as Newest Member of BRICS

Jan 07, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Brazil has announced that Indonesia has become a full member of the BRICS bloc, confirming Indonesia's candidacy was approved in August 2023.

  • Indonesia is the world’s fourth-most populous country and has the largest economy in Southeast Asia.
  • The decision to join followed the formation of Indonesia's newly elected government in 2024.
  • The Brazilian government emphasized the shared commitment to reforming global governance.
  • The BRICS group was established in 2009 and has expanded to include several nations, with further applications from Turkey, Azerbaijan, and Malaysia.
  • Concerns persist regarding alternative currencies to the US dollar among some BRICS members.
“With the largest population and economy in Southeast Asia, Indonesia shares with other members a commitment to reforming global governance institutions.”

In conclusion, Indonesia's membership in BRICS signifies a growing collaboration among key developing economies and may influence global economic dynamics.

item.title: Samsung Expands ‘AI for All’ Vision at CES 2025 To Bring AI Everyday, Everywhere - samsung.com
item.description:
Samsung Expands 'AI for All' Vision at CES 2025 To Bring AI Everyday, Everywhere

Date: January 2025, Source: Samsung News

Samsung Electronics introduced its new “AI for All” vision during CES 2025, focusing on integrating AI across everyday experiences and devices for enhanced user personalization.

  • Samsung’s roadmap for Home AI reallocates resources to redefine home experiences through personalization.
  • Enhanced focus on security and privacy through Samsung Knox Matrix for protecting user data across devices.
  • Integration of AI-driven health insights via Galaxy devices.
  • Expansion of the SmartThings platform to include business and automotive applications.
  • Initiatives such as Samsung Solve for Tomorrow aim to motivate young innovators and promote sustainable practices.
“I’m proud of how we have introduced new technologies and intelligence to the home, connected key devices and set the standard for the home of the future,” - Jong-Hee Han.

In conclusion, Samsung's expanded AI vision aims to empower users through enhanced personalization, security, and sustainability initiatives, highlighting its commitment to innovation and community engagement.

item.title: What happens now that Justin Trudeau is resigning as Canada's prime minister? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
What happens now that Justin Trudeau is resigning as Canada's prime minister?

Publication Date: Monday, Source: Hindustan Times

Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced he will step down in the coming months after nine years in power due to worsening pre-election polling for his Liberal Party. He will remain in his position until a new leader is chosen.

  • Trudeau will not leave office immediately; he will stay on until the Liberal Party elects a new leader.
  • No immediate election is expected as parliament is prorogued until March 24, delaying any non-confidence motions.
  • The Liberal Party is anticipated to implement a shortened leadership selection process to choose a successor quickly.
  • Polls indicate a significant defeat for the Liberals in the upcoming election, regardless of the new leader.
  • Potential candidates to succeed Trudeau include top ministers like Francois-Philippe Champagne and Anita Anand.
“The governor general won't dismiss a prime minister who still holds the confidence of the Commons.” - Philippe Lagasse, constitutional expert

In conclusion, Trudeau's resignation will trigger a crucial period of transition within the Liberal Party, with significant implications for the next election.

item.title: Azaad Trailer Launch: Ajay Devgn On His Bond With Nephew Aaman Devgan: ‘Woh Mere Bete Jaisa Nahi…’ - News18
item.description:
Azaad Trailer Launch: Ajay Devgn On His Bond With Nephew Aaman Devgan: ‘Woh Mere Bete Jaisa Nahi…’

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: News18

During the launch of the trailer for 'Azaad', Ajay Devgn spoke about his close relationship with his nephew Aaman Devgan, emphasizing that he considers Aaman as his own son. The film marks the acting debut of both Aaman and Raveena Tandon’s daughter, Rasha Thadani.

  • Ajay Devgn expressed that 'Azaad' is incredibly special to him.
  • The film features the debut of Aaman Devgan and Rasha Thadani.
  • Ajay praised the talents of both newcomers and the direction of Abhishek Kapoor.
  • 'Azaad' is set in pre-independence India, featuring a gripping narrative involving themes of bravery and family.
“Ye film mere liye kaafi maaino me special hai... Aaman, jo mere bete jaisa nahi, but beta hai.”

Azaad is directed by Abhishek Kapoor and is scheduled to release in theatres on January 17, 2025.

item.title: First U.S. bird flu death reported in Louisiana patient, officials say - The Washington Post
item.description:
First U.S. Bird Flu Death Reported in Louisiana

Publication Date: December 18, 2024

Source: Louisiana Department of Health

A Louisiana man has become the first person in the United States to die of avian influenza, state health officials reported Monday. The patient had underlying medical conditions and was hospitalized weeks ago in critical condition.

  • The patient was older than 65 and had been in contact with sick and dead birds on his property.
  • He was hospitalized with severe respiratory illness related to the H5N1 bird flu virus.
“This is a serious situation, and we must remain vigilant,” state officials stated.

The death of this patient raises concerns about the potential human health risks of avian influenza and emphasizes the need for continued monitoring and preventive measures.

item.title: Louisiana reports first human death in US from bird flu - The Guardian
item.description:
Louisiana Reports First Human Death in US from Bird Flu

Publication Date: [Publication Date Needed] | Source: Associated Press

A patient in Louisiana has become the first human in the US to die of bird flu. The Louisiana department of health reported that the patient, over the age of 65 with underlying medical conditions, contracted H5N1 after exposure to birds.

  • This is the first human case in the US linked to exposure to backyard birds.
  • A genetic analysis suggested that the virus mutated within the patient, potentially leading to severe illness.
  • There are no additional H5N1 cases or evidence of person-to-person transmission identified.
  • The current public health risk for the general public is deemed low.
  • 66 confirmed bird flu infections have been reported in the US since March last year.
“The department expresses its deepest condolences to the patient’s family and friends as they mourn the loss of their loved one.”

In conclusion, while the public health risk remains low, individuals working with birds or livestock are at a higher risk of exposure to H5N1.

item.title: America’s first bird flu death reported in Louisiana - CNN International
item.description:
America’s First Bird Flu Death Reported in Louisiana

Publication Date: December 30, 2024

Source: CNN

The first confirmed human death from H5N1 bird flu has been reported in Louisiana, marking a significant health concern. The individual had pre-existing health conditions and had been in contact with infected birds.

  • The patient, over 65, had underlying health issues and was hospitalized after exposure to both domestic and wild birds.
  • Health officials have not identified any other human cases linked to this infection.
  • Experts warn that H5N1 is a severe strain; the case fatality rate globally is about 50% based on reported infections.
  • The CDC is monitoring the virus's evolution, noting genetic changes that may enhance its infectiousness in humans.
  • Guidance has been issued for individuals working with or in contact with birds, stressing the importance of avoiding sick animals.
“The evolution of the virus is concerning but highlights how we need to prevent each possible spillover infection to reduce the risk of onward transmission to others.” - Dr. Seema Lakdawala

The death has raised alarms over the potential spread of H5N1, although authorities maintain that the immediate risk to the general public remains low.

item.title: Bigg Boss 18: Vivian Dsena reveals he had cut off ties with Kamya Punjabi; expresses hurt over Salman Kha - The Times of India
item.description:
Bigg Boss 18: Vivian Dsena reveals he had cut off ties with Kamya Punjabi; expresses hurt over Salman Khan's remarks on his life, comparison with Karan Veer

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: India Times

In a recent interview, actor Vivian Dsena discussed his emotional experience of severing ties with fellow participant Kamya Punjabi and shared his feelings regarding comparisons made by Salman Khan between him and Karan Veer. He expressed hurt over these remarks, emphasizing their impact on his personal life.

  • Vivian Dsena criticizes Salman Khan's comments.
  • He reveals he has cut off personal ties with Kamya Punjabi.
  • Comparison with Karan Veer was unexpected and upset him.
“It’s painful to be compared to others, especially by someone I respect,” said Dsena.

This revelation sheds light on the emotional challenges faced by reality show participants and the pressures accompanying public scrutiny.

item.title: Game Changer: 2 Fans Die After Attending Ram Charan Film's Pre-Release Event; Dil Raju Offers Rs10-Lakh Aid - News18
item.description:
Game Changer: 2 Fans Die After Attending Ram Charan Film's Pre-Release Event; Dil Raju Offers Rs10-Lakh Aid

Date: January 06, 2025 Source: News18

Two Ram Charan fans tragically lost their lives after attending the film's pre-release event in Rajahmundry. They were involved in a fatal accident while returning home.

  • The deceased fans were identified as Arava Manikanta (23) and Thokada Charan (22).
  • The accident occurred when their bike was hit by a van shortly after the event.
  • Dil Raju, the film's producer, has offered financial support of Rs 10 lakh to the victims' families.
  • Pawan Kalyan, among the attendees, has also promised Rs 5 lakh support to each family.
  • This incident comes a month after another tragic event related to fan safety at a film screening.
“I pray that their souls rest in peace, and we will stand by and support the two families.” – Dil Raju

This unfortunate incident highlights the need for improved safety measures at public events to prevent similar tragedies in the future.

item.title: HMPV Symptoms And Treatment: How Common Is The Virus And How To Take Care Of Its Patients? - News18
item.description:
HMPV Symptoms And Treatment: How Common Is The Virus And How To Take Care Of Its Patients?

Publication Date: January 06, 2025

Source: News18

The article discusses the recent detection of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) cases in India, specifically in Karnataka. It covers symptoms, transmission, and treatment options for HMPV, highlighting its prevalence and preventive measures.

Key Points:

  • ICMR detected two HMPV cases in Karnataka, both infants diagnosed with bronchopneumonia.
  • HMPV symptoms resemble those of the common cold, but can escalate to more severe respiratory issues.
  • The virus is transmitted through direct contact and respiratory droplets.
  • HMPV primarily affects young children and the elderly, with a risk of severe illness in vulnerable populations.

Notable Quotes:

“HMPV is already in circulation globally, including in India, with no unusual surge in respiratory illnesses reported.”

In conclusion, while HMPV cases have been identified, the situation appears manageable with existing public health measures, as stated by health officials.

item.title: AMD’s new Ryzen Z2 CPUs boost gaming handhelds, if you buy the best one - Ars Technica
item.description:
AMD’s new Ryzen Z2 CPUs boost gaming handhelds, if you buy the best one

Publication Date: January 2025, Source: Ars Technica

AMD has announced its Ryzen Z2 processors, a refresh of the Ryzen Z1 lineup tailored for handheld gaming PCs, with three new models set for release in early 2025.

  • The Ryzen Z2 Extreme enhances CPU and GPU architectures for improved performance.
  • The new lineup includes eight CPU cores and a powerful RDNA 3.5 GPU.
  • The base Ryzen Z2 appears similar to the Ryzen Z1 Extreme but retains its core specifications.
“These should both provide small bumps to CPU and GPU performance relative to the Ryzen Z1 Extreme.”

In conclusion, with the launch of Ryzen Z2 CPUs, AMD aims to elevate the gaming handheld experience, but potential buyers should consider which variant offers the best value.

item.title: Donald Trump reacts to Justin Trudeau's resignation: 'If Canada merges with US... ' - The Times of India
item.description:
Donald Trump reacts to Justin Trudeau's resignation: 'If Canada merges with US... '

Publication Date: [Date not provided]Source: [Source not provided]

In response to Justin Trudeau's recent resignation, Donald Trump has commented about the possibility of Canada merging with the United States, sparking discussions on social media.

  • Justin Trudeau has stepped down from his position as Prime Minister of Canada.
  • Trump's remarks hint at the implications of Canadian politics on U.S.-Canada relations.
  • The comment has generated significant attention and debate across various platforms.
Trump stated, "If Canada merges with the US, it could lead to new opportunities for both nations."

This reaction highlights the interconnectedness of political events in North America and the potential changes in diplomatic relations.

item.title: US VP Kamala Harris certifies her defeat to Donald Trump four years post Capitol riots - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kamala Harris Certifies Trump's Victory Four Years Post Capitol Riots

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

On January 6, 2025, Vice President Kamala Harris presided over the ceremonial certification of her electoral defeat to Donald Trump, marking a significant moment in the aftermath of the Capitol riots.

  • Kamala Harris held a ceremonial role in certifying the election results.
  • She expressed the importance of a peaceful transfer of power, calling it a “sacred obligation.”
  • Harris's certification comes four years after the violent interruption of the certification process by Trump supporters.
  • Notably, no other vice president had certified their loss while the incoming president had not conceded a previous defeat.
  • Harris was evacuated from a nearby location during the January 6 riots.
  • Trump faced criminal charges connected to his attempts to overturn the 2020 election results.
“A fundamental principle of American democracy is that when we lose an election, we accept the results,” said Kamala Harris.

This moment underscores the resilience of democratic processes even in the face of past turmoil.

item.title: U.S. Congress certifies Trump election victory for January 20 inauguration - The Hindu
item.description:
U.S. Congress Certifies Trump Election Victory for January 20 Inauguration

Date: January 07, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The U.S. Congress formally certified Republican President-elect Donald Trump's election victory over Democratic Vice President Kamala Harris, allowing him to take office on January 20, 2025.

  • The joint session of Congress took place on January 6, 2025, presided over by Vice President Harris.
  • Mr. Trump won 312 Electoral College votes to Ms. Harris’s 226.
  • No attempts were made by Democrats to block the certification.
  • Security was heightened around the Capitol during the certification process due to past events.
"Congress certifies our great election victory today - a big moment in history. MAGA!" - Donald Trump

The certification underscores the transition of power amidst heavy security, reflecting lessons learned from previous Capitol events. With Republicans controlling both the White House and Congress, Trump's administration is expected to pursue significant policy changes.

item.title: Hyderabad's 2nd longest flyover named after Dr Singh - Deccan Chronicle
item.description:
Hyderabad's 2nd Longest Flyover Named After Dr. Manmohan Singh

Publication Date: Monday
Source: Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy's inauguration announcement

The Chief Minister of Hyderabad, A. Revanth Reddy, inaugurated the city's second longest flyover at Aramghar and named it after former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh.

  • The flyover spans four kilometers and connects Aramghar with Zoo Park.
  • It was constructed at a cost of Rs. 790 crore under the Strategic Road Development Programme.
  • Revanth Reddy emphasized the importance of Dr. Singh's contributions to the country during his tenure.
  • Plans for further development of the Old City include a cable bridge over Mir Alam Tank and construction of educational institutions.
  • Reddy asserted the government's commitment to addressing local issues and enhancing the beauty of Hyderabad.
“We only compete with ourselves in development.” - Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy

The inauguration of the flyover is seen as a step towards ongoing development in Hyderabad, reinforcing the government's focus on improving infrastructure and quality of life for residents.

item.title: Alphabet to bring Gemini AI to TV sets running on Google operating system - Business Standard
item.description:
Alphabet to Bring Gemini AI to TV Sets Running on Google Operating System

Publication Date: Jan 06 2025 | Source: Bloomberg

Alphabet Inc. is set to enhance the experience of Google TV users by integrating Gemini AI into its voice-control system, allowing for more natural and intuitive interactions with their television sets.

  • The upgrade allows users to have conversations with their TVs without needing to say “Hey Google” for each command.
  • Other features include improved content search and better integration with YouTube.
  • This marks the first time Gemini is coming to third-party TV sets made by companies like Sony and TCL.
  • An “always-on” mode will also be introduced, detecting user presence and providing customized information.
  • The rollout is expected to commence later in 2025.
“The Gemini upgrade… will allow users to hold back-and-forth conversations with third-party TVs.”

This upgrade represents a significant step for Google in enhancing user interaction with TVs, positioning its Google TV platform competitively against other major TV operating systems.

item.title: Hisense’s TriChroma TV could be the middle ground between Mini LED and MicroLED - The Verge
item.description:
Hisense’s TriChroma TV could be the middle ground between Mini LED and MicroLED

Publication Date: January 2024 | Source: Hisense Press Release

Hisense showcases its new large-scale TVs at CES, featuring the 136-inch MicroLED and the 116-inch TriChroma LED TV, aiming to enhance home theater experiences.

  • The 136-inch MicroLED 136MX is touted as a consumer-ready MicroLED display but remains high-end and expensive.
  • Hisense claims the 136MX represents a significant step towards making cutting-edge display technology more accessible.
  • The TV uses over 24.88 million microscopic LEDs for exceptional brightness and quality without the risk of burn-in.
  • The new TriChroma LED TV utilizes RGB Local Dimming Technology to achieve a vibrant color spectrum and high brightness levels.
  • The TriChroma is reported to cover 97% of the BT.2020 color space, making it superior in color vibrance among Mini LED displays.
  • No pricing or release date information is available yet for the TriChroma TV.

The 136MX builds on Hisense’s legacy of display innovation, leveraging a high-density array of over 24.88 million microscopic LEDs to deliver unparalleled brightness, resolution, and precision.

Both TVs aim to redefine viewing experiences, but they remain high-end options for most consumers.

item.title: Sugary drinks linked to millions of new diabetes and heart disease cases – study - The Guardian
item.description:
Sugary drinks linked to millions of new diabetes and heart disease cases – study

Publication Date: Monday Source: Nature Medicine

Sugary drinks are a significant health risk, linked to more than 2.2 million new diabetes cases and 1.1 million new cases of heart disease each year worldwide. The analysis highlights health inequalities, particularly in Latin America and sub-Saharan Africa.

The study found:

  • Sugary drinks caused nearly 24% of new diabetes cases in Latin America in 2020.
  • In sub-Saharan Africa, they led to over 21% of new diabetes cases.
  • Colombia, Mexico, and South Africa are severely affected.
  • In Colombia, sugary drinks account for almost 48% of new diabetes cases.
  • About one-third of new diabetes cases in Mexico are caused by sugary drinks.
“Sugar-sweetened beverages are heavily marketed and sold in low- and middle-income nations...” - Dariush Mozaffarian

This study emphasizes the need for public health campaigns and regulation of sugary drink advertising to mitigate health risks associated with consumption.
